intro: Antherothamnus pearsonii, commonly known as the Pearson's thornstep, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of western North America. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. Antherothamnus pearsonii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
